concept.title: Install, uninstall & update BTS

conbody.p: Make sure that you have the latest Java-version installed on your OS. Receive the latest zip-archive "bts.zip" from the server. Should be changed into "download from..." or whatever the possibility to get the file may be later on. Locate your "bts.zip" file on your system and open the archive. Extract all files into a directory of your choice.
Notice: We recommend that you use the "standard" installation path which is "c:\bts". Otherwise you will have to make some changes within the next steps.
Locate the directory you just extracted in the step before and start "bts.exe" by double-clicking or pressing enter on your keyboard. BTS Installation Wizard will start:

ul.li: Database Installation Directory: The directory of your repository must be entered here. A standard location is automatically entered here refering to: "C:\bts\dbdir". In case you have extracted your bts-archive somewhere else you will have to change the path of "dbdir" here. Click "Browse File System..." to determine the path of directory of your BTS by browsing through explorer if you are not sure about the correct path.

Http Port of your CouchDB on Localhost: Enter the number of the port of the server here where your CouchDB service is installed and configurated. At the moment this is the localhost of the TLA-server.
Click "Next" to continue to the next step. Click "Cancel" to abort the installation.

li.u: Welcome to the Berlin Text System Installation

ul.li: Do you have a BTS Server URL?: Click yes if you have access to a project using BTS or no if you are a single user (local version). Click "Next" to continue to the next step. Click "Cancel" to abort the installation.
Server URL: Enter the URL of the server that you have access to. Standard BBAW at the moment: http://aaew64.bbaw.de:9586
Your User Name: Enter your username.
Your Password for Authentication: Enter your password.

After entering the information required, click "Connect to server". Afterwards click "Next" to continue to the next step. Click "Cancel" to abort the installation.
Notice: Do not click "Finish" (AT THE MOMENT).
Select your main working project: Select the project you are part of. The possibility of selecting-options depends on the server you connected with within the step before.

Further projects from which you want to load and read data: Select a project from "Available Projects" (left text box) and click "Add" to add a project. The project should then appear in the right text box.
Click "Next" to continue to the next step. Click "Cancel" to abort the installation.

The Installation Wizard will now install the BTS files on your system. Click "Finish" to start the installation. Notice: The installation will not start until you click the "Finish" button, eventhough it looks like it would.

After the installation has finished, the programm will automatically start and the programm will index the necessary data from the server you have entered byfore. The "Database Manager" will open. Notice that you have to wait until indexing is finished. This may take a while. Congratulations, your BTS-installation is complete.

conbody.p: Whithin your first BTS-start, you will have to configure your program individually. A few preferences are set by standard, but checking and setting individual options are recommended. Therefore open the preferences:
1) "Configuration" and check wether your prefered setting is currently activated.

2) "Corpus Settings" -> "Corpus Navigator Settings": Activate "Corpus Navigator sort by key". Press "Apply" to save this setting. You can also apply all changes together by pressing "Apply" after setting all required options. This will save all changes together. Notice that closing the preferences-window or pressing "Cancel" will discard all changes.

3) "EgyTextEditor" -> "SignTextEditor": Activate every option you wish. Activating "Show Hieroglyphs", "Show Lemma ID", "Show Flexion" and "Show Translation" (language you will work with) are recommended to use the Sign Text Editor properly.

4) "Lemma List Settings": If you selected "Yes" in Installating BTS -> 2) then the project of your workgroup should appear here in selection. If not, select it (If it does not show up at all, contact your admin). Select all Lemma lists you want and add them to the active tree.
5) "Lemma Navigator Settings": Activate "Lemma Navigator sort by sort key".
8) Press "Apply" to save all changes and close the window by pressing "OK".
Congratulations, your BTS is now configured.
